words.english: What do you do for a living?

words.spanish: ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
words.english: What do you like to do in your free time?

words.spanish: ¿Cuál es tu mejor recuerdo de la infancia?
words.english: What is your best childhood memory?

words.spanish: ¿Cuál es el mejor viaje que has hecho?
words.english: What is the best trip you have taken?
What have you learned this year?
I would like to know more

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Hola, soy Elena. ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
dialog.english: Hello, I'm Elena. What do you like to do in your free time?

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Hola, soy Pablo. Me gusta mucho leer y escuchar música. ¿Y a ti?
dialog.english: Hello, I'm Pablo. I really like to read and listen to music. And you?

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: A mí me gusta pintar. Cuéntame sobre tu música favorita.
dialog.english: I like to paint. Tell me about your favorite music.

dialog.speaker: Pablo
dialog.spanish: Me gusta la música rock de los 80s. ¿En serio te gusta pintar?
dialog.english: I like rock music from the 80s. Do you really like to paint?

dialog.speaker: Elena
dialog.spanish: Sí, es mi pasatiempo favorito. Es muy interesante.
dialog.english: Yes, it's my favorite hobby. It's very interesting.

questions.question: ¿Qué le pregunta Elena a Pablo?
options: Sus planes para el fin de semana

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Cuéntame sobre tu música favorita'?
options: Tell me about your favorite music
questions.answer: Tell me about your favorite music

questions.question: ¿Qué le responde Pablo sobre su música favorita?

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bueno verte! ¿Cuál es el mejor viaje que has hecho?
dialog.english: It's good to see you! What is the best trip you have taken?

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: El mejor viaje que he hecho fue a Colombia. ¡Fue increíble!
dialog.english: The best trip I have taken was to Colombia. It was incredible!

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: ¿En serio? ¿Cómo fue la experiencia?
dialog.english: Really? How was the experience?

dialog.speaker: Ana
dialog.spanish: La comida era deliciosa y la gente muy amable. ¿Y tú, has viajado mucho?
dialog.english: The food was delicious and the people were very kind. And you, have you traveled much?

dialog.speaker: Carlos
dialog.spanish: Sí, he viajado a México. Me gustaría saber más sobre Colombia.
dialog.english: Yes, I have traveled to Mexico. I would like to know more about Colombia.

questions.question: ¿Qué le pregunta Carlos a Ana?
options: Sobre el mejor viaje que ha hecho
questions.answer: Sobre el mejor viaje que ha hecho

questions.question: ¿Qué le gustó a Ana de su viaje a Colombia?

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: He estado pensando en la tecnología. ¿Qué opinas de las redes sociales?
dialog.english: I've been thinking about technology. What's your opinion on social media?

dialog.speaker: José
dialog.spanish: Creo que son buenas para conectar con personas, pero también son adictivas.
dialog.english: I think they are good for connecting with people, but they are also addictive.

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Estoy de acuerdo. ¿Por qué crees que son adictivas?
dialog.english: I agree. Why do you think they are addictive?

dialog.speaker: José
dialog.spanish: Porque siempre queremos ver qué están haciendo los demás. ¡Qué interesante!
dialog.english: Because we always want to see what others are doing. How interesting!

dialog.speaker: María
dialog.spanish: Sí, me gustaría saber más sobre ese tema. Vamos a hablarlo más.
dialog.english: Yes, I would like to know more about that topic. Let's talk about it more.

questions.question: ¿Qué le pregunta María a José?
options: Sobre su opinión de las redes sociales
questions.answer: Sobre su opinión de las redes sociales

questions.question: ¿Qué significa '¿Por qué crees que son adictivas?'?
options: Why do you think they are popular?
Why do you think they are addictive?
Why do you think they are good?
Why do you think they are bad?
questions.answer: Why do you think they are addictive?

questions.question: ¿Cómo cree José que las redes sociales son buenas?

dialog.speaker: Diego
dialog.spanish: Hola. ¿Qué quieres lograr en el futuro?
dialog.english: Hello. What do you want to achieve in the future?

dialog.speaker: Valeria
dialog.spanish: Quiero ser una artista. Me gustaría viajar y pintar.
dialog.english: I want to be an artist. I would like to travel and paint.

dialog.speaker: Diego
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! ¿Cómo piensas lograrlo?
dialog.english: How great! How do you plan to achieve it?

dialog.speaker: Valeria
dialog.spanish: Quiero ir a la universidad para estudiar arte. ¿Y tú, qué quieres hacer?
dialog.english: I want to go to university to study art. And you, what do you want to do?

dialog.speaker: Diego
dialog.spanish: Yo quiero trabajar en marketing. Me gustaría saber más sobre tu plan.
dialog.english: I want to work in marketing. I would like to know more about your plan.

questions.question: ¿Qué significa '¿Cómo piensas lograrlo?'?
options: How do you plan to achieve it?
questions.answer: How do you plan to achieve it?

questions.question: ¿Qué quiere hacer Valeria para lograr sus metas?

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: He estado pensando en mi pasado. ¿Cuál es un recuerdo de tu infancia que te hace feliz?
dialog.english: I've been thinking about my past. What is a memory from your childhood that makes you happy?

dialog.speaker: Camila
dialog.spanish: El recuerdo de jugar con mi abuela en el jardín. Ella era muy graciosa.
dialog.english: The memory of playing with my grandmother in the garden. She was very funny.

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: ¡Qué bien! Me gustaría saber más de ella.
dialog.english: How great! I would like to know more about her.

dialog.speaker: Camila
dialog.spanish: Ella me enseñó a cocinar. ¿Y tú, qué recuerdo tienes?
dialog.english: She taught me how to cook. And you, what memory do you have?

dialog.speaker: Mario
dialog.spanish: El recuerdo de mi perro. Él me hacía reír mucho.
dialog.english: The memory of my dog. He made me laugh a lot.

questions.question: ¿Qué significa 'Me gustaría saber más de ella'?
options: I would like to meet her
I would like to know more about her
I want to talk to her
questions.answer: I would like to know more about her

sentences.spanish: Hoy llegó un nuevo compañero al trabajo. Su nombre es Leo. Quería conocerlo.
sentences.english: Today a new colleague arrived at work. His name is Leo. I wanted to get to know him.

sentences.spanish: Le pregunté, '¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?'. Él me respondió que le gusta hacer senderismo.
sentences.english: I asked him, 'What do you like to do in your free time?'. He responded that he likes to go hiking.

sentences.spanish: Le dije, '¡Qué interesante! ¿Cuál es la mejor ruta que has hecho?'. Su respuesta fue muy larga y detallada.
sentences.english: I said to him, 'How interesting! What is the best trail you have done?'. His answer was very long and detailed.

sentences.spanish: Me gustaría saber más de su vida, así que le pregunté por su pasado. Fue una buena conversación.
sentences.english: I would like to know more about his life, so I asked him about his past. It was a good conversation.

sentences.spanish: Ahora tengo un nuevo amigo. La clave para conocer a alguien es hacerle buenas preguntas.
sentences.english: Now I have a new friend. The key to getting to know someone is asking them good questions.

sentences.spanish: Fui a una cita con una chica llamada Ana. Yo no quería que fuera aburrida.
sentences.english: I went on a date with a girl named Ana. I didn't want it to be boring.

sentences.spanish: Le pregunté, '¿Qué te gustaría hacer en el futuro?'. Ella me contó sobre sus sueños.
sentences.english: I asked her, 'What would you like to do in the future?'. She told me about her dreams.

sentences.spanish: Yo le pregunté, '¿Cómo te sientes sobre...?'. Ella compartió sus opiniones conmigo.
sentences.english: I asked her, 'How do you feel about...?'. She shared her opinions with me.

sentences.spanish: La conversación fluyó toda la noche. Ana dijo que le gustó mucho que la escuchara.
sentences.english: The conversation flowed all night. Ana said that she really liked that I listened to her.

sentences.spanish: Pienso que las buenas preguntas son más importantes que hablar de uno mismo.
sentences.english: I think that good questions are more important than talking about oneself.

sentences.spanish: Estaba en una reunión familiar. Vi a mi primo, quien no había visto en años.
sentences.english: I was at a family reunion. I saw my cousin, whom I hadn't seen in years.

sentences.spanish: Le pregunté, '¿Qué has aprendido este año?'. Él me contó sobre su nuevo trabajo.
sentences.english: I asked him, 'What have you learned this year?'. He told me about his new job.

sentences.spanish: Después, le pregunté, '¿Qué opinas de la situación actual?'. Tuvimos una conversación muy profunda.
sentences.english: Afterwards, I asked him, 'What's your opinion on the current situation?'. We had a very deep conversation.

sentences.spanish: Yo sentí que nos conectamos de nuevo. Las preguntas me ayudaron a entenderlo mejor.
sentences.english: I felt that we reconnected. The questions helped me understand him better.

sentences.spanish: La próxima vez que lo vea, voy a preguntar más. Es la mejor manera de mantener la conexión.
sentences.english: The next time I see him, I'm going to ask more questions. It's the best way to maintain the connection.

speaking.title: Teniendo Conversaciones
speaking.description: Preguntas y respuestas para iniciar y mantener conversaciones interesantes.

question.spanish: ¿Qué te gusta hacer en tu tiempo libre?
question.english: What do you like to do in your free time?

answer.spanish: Me gusta viajar y aprender cosas nuevas.
answer.english: I like to travel and learn new things.

question.english: What is your favorite movie?

answer.spanish: Mi película favorita es 'El Padrino'. ¿Y la tuya?
answer.english: My favorite movie is 'The Godfather'. And yours?

question.english: Tell me about your job.

answer.spanish: Trabajo como ingeniero de software. Es un trabajo interesante.
answer.english: I work as a software engineer. It's an interesting job.

question.english: What's your opinion on climate change?

answer.spanish: Creo que es un problema muy serio y debemos hacer algo.
answer.english: I believe it's a very serious problem and we should do something.

question.english: Have you traveled to any other country?

answer.spanish: Sí, he viajado a Francia y España.
answer.english: Yes, I have traveled to France and Spain.

question.spanish: ¿Cuál es el mejor viaje que has hecho?
question.english: What is the best trip you have taken?

answer.spanish: El mejor viaje fue a Japón. La comida era increíble.
answer.english: The best trip was to Japan. The food was incredible.

question.english: What have you learned this year?

answer.spanish: He aprendido a ser más paciente y organizado.
answer.english: I have learned to be more patient and organized.

question.spanish: ¿Quién es tu héroe o heroína de la vida real?
question.english: Who is your real-life hero or heroine?

answer.spanish: Mi madre es mi heroína. Ella es muy trabajadora.
answer.english: My mother is my heroine. She is very hard-working.

question.english: What would you do if you won the lottery?

answer.spanish: Viajaría por todo el mundo y donaría dinero a la caridad.
answer.english: I would travel around the world and donate money to charity.

question.spanish: ¿Dónde te gustaría vivir en el futuro?
question.english: Where would you like to live in the future?

answer.spanish: Me gustaría vivir en un lugar con clima cálido.
answer.english: I would like to live in a place with a warm climate.

question.english: What is your house like?

answer.spanish: Mi casa es pequeña pero acogedora. Me gusta mucho.
answer.english: My house is small but cozy. I like it a lot.

question.english: Tell me an interesting story.

answer.spanish: Una vez, vi una película muy graciosa que me hizo reír por días.
answer.english: Once, I saw a very funny movie that made me laugh for days.

question.english: What have you eaten today?

answer.spanish: Hoy he comido un sándwich y una manzana.
answer.english: Today I have eaten a sandwich and an apple.

question.english: Why do you study Spanish?

answer.spanish: Estudio español para poder viajar más fácil.
answer.english: I study Spanish so I can travel more easily.

question.spanish: ¿Qué te ha parecido la clase de hoy?
question.english: What did you think of today's class?

answer.spanish: La clase de hoy me ha parecido muy útil.
answer.english: Today's class seemed very useful to me.

question.english: Tell me more about your family.

answer.spanish: Mi familia es grande. Tengo dos hermanos y una hermana.
answer.english: My family is big. I have two brothers and one sister.

question.english: What song do you like the most?

answer.spanish: Me gusta la canción 'Havana' de Camila Cabello.
answer.english: I like the song 'Havana' by Camila Cabello.

question.spanish: ¿Qué te gustaría hacer este fin de semana?
question.english: What would you like to do this weekend?

answer.spanish: Me gustaría ir al parque a leer un libro.
answer.english: I would like to go to the park to read a book.

question.english: How do you feel about your past?

answer.spanish: Me siento bien con mi pasado. Me hizo quien soy hoy.
answer.english: I feel good about my past. It made me who I am today.

question.spanish: ¿Cuál es tu mejor recuerdo de la infancia?
question.english: What is your best childhood memory?

answer.spanish: Mi mejor recuerdo es ir a la playa con mis abuelos.
answer.english: My best memory is going to the beach with my grandparents.
